title: Aspire Home Finance launches home loan division for low income women segment
text: Aspire Home Finance launches home loan division for low income women segment By Kailash Babar , ET Bureau | 2 Jul, 2015, 05.34PM IST MUMBAI: Aspire Home Finance Corporation Ltd , a subsidiary of Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd, has launched a home loan division for low income women segment. The division Mahila Awas Loan from Aspire or MALA will offer loans starting from 2 lakhs to 12 lakhs to both salaried and self-employed women for purchase and construction of affordable housing units, the housing finance company said in a release. All branches under MALA division would be exclusively manned by women staff and first branch has been opened in Naigaon, Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR). Aspire Home Finance Corporation (AHFCL) plans to open more such branches in Maharashtra, Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh in a phased manner. Aspire is looking to provide housing loan assistance to 1,000 women customers in the current financial year under MALA program. "Being a low and mid income home finance company with focus only in retail home loans, post a comprehensive research, we decided to bring in a product to cater to low income women customers," said Anil Sachidanand , MD & CEO of Aspire Home Finance Corporation. The loans for affordable housing for women from low income group will be offered at an interest rate of 10-12.5%. Projects where 70% construction has already been completed will only be considered for affordable housing loans for these women, Sachidanand added.
